page.title: 15GEESTS BANANAS, WARMINSTER
page.content: Geests opened in 1958 and now employs 86 townspeople handling all sorts of fruit and produce, but particularly bananas, which come mainly from the Windward Islands. The bananas are delivered in an unripe condition, so they go into a ripening room. There are 41 rooms holding about 15000 bananas altogether: every room is fumigated to kill crawling insects. During ripening, which usually takes 6 days, the air temperature must be controlled to within half a degree F. Bananas produce their own heat so air cooling systems are used. The exact temperature settings depend on where the bananas came from, the stage of ripening, and how long they are to be held before distribution. Some fruit and produce is sold locally; the rest is distributed by lorry to major towns within 100 miles radius.
